net.asrex.skillful

Class PlayerNetworkHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.asrex.skillful.PlayerNetworkHelper

  • public class PlayerNetworkHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    General utilities for managing player data sync between the server and clients, and safely dispatching events that need to take both sides into account. These methods are the only recommended way to perform many tasks and, in many cases, are the only methods which will dispatch necessary events.

    In all cases, methods in this class are only intended for use on the server. If called from a client context, they will throw an exception.

    • Method Detail

      • updateSkillInfo

        public static void updateSkillInfo(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
        Sends the current PlayerSkillInfo to the given player's client via a SkillInfoMessage.

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to update
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context

      • toggleEffect

        public static void toggleEffect(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                java.lang.String perkName,
                java.lang.String effectName,
                boolean state)
        Toggles the given effect, either enabling or disabling it on both the client and server.

        The server will immediately execute Effect.enable(), and an EffectToggleMessage will be sent to the client to enable the effect on the client.

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context.

        Parameters:
        player - the player on which to toggle the effect
        perkName - the name of the effect's parent perk (to uniquely identify the effect in the PerkRegistry)
        effectName - the name of the effect
        state - if true enable the effect; if false, disable it
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        EffectActivationException - if the player does not have a matching perk-effect pair, if attempting to disable an AbilityDefinition, or if the effect does not exist in the player's active effects

      • toggleEffect

        public static void toggleEffect(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                Effect effect,
                boolean state)
        Toggles the given effect, either enabling or disabling it on both the client and server.

        The server will immediately execute Effect.enable(), and an EffectToggleMessage will be sent to the client to enable the effect on the client.

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context.

        Parameters:
        player - the player on which to toggle the effect
        effect - the effect instance to toggle
        state - if true, enable the effect; if false, disable it

      • addAndActivateEffect

        public static void addAndActivateEffect(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                        java.lang.String perkName,
                        java.lang.String effectName)
        Adds the given effect to the player's active effects and enables it. The player's client will first be updated PlayerSkillInfo, and then the effect is activated with a call to Effect.enable() on the server, while a EffectToggleMessage is sent to the player to activate on the client.

        If no matching effect can be found (as determined by the unique perkName and effectName combination), an EffectActivationException will be thrown. Similarly, if an equivalent effect is already active on the player (enabled or not), an EffectActivationException will also be thrown.

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context.

        Parameters:
        player - the player on which to apply the effect
        perkName - the name of the effect's parent perk (to uniquely identify the effect in the PerkRegistry)
        effectName - the name of the effect
        Throws:
        EffectActivationException - if a matching effect is already active on the player, or if no matching effect can be found
        See Also:
        updateSkillInfo(EntityPlayer), toggleEffect(EntityPlayer, String, String, boolean)

      • addAndActivateEffect

        public static void addAndActivateEffect(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                        Effect effect)
        Adds the given effect to the player's active effects and enables it. The player's client will first be updated PlayerSkillInfo, and then the effect is activated with a call to Effect.enable() on the server, while a EffectToggleMessage is sent to the player to activate on the client.

        Unlike addAndActivateEffect(EntityPlayer, String, String), this method expects a fully initialized Effect instance (see PerkRegistry.createEffect(EntityPlayer, String, String)).

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context.

        Parameters:
        player - the player on which to apply the effect
        effect - the effect to apply
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        EffectActivationException - if a matching effect is already active on the player
        See Also:
        updateSkillInfo(EntityPlayer), toggleEffect(EntityPlayer, Effect, boolean)

      • removeAndDeactivateEffect

        public static void removeAndDeactivateEffect(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                             java.lang.String perkName,
                             java.lang.String effectName)
        Disables the matched effect for the given player on both the server and client, and removes it from the player's list of active effects. The client will receive updated skill info with the effect removed immediately after it has been disabled.

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context.

        Parameters:
        player - the player from which to remove the effect
        perkName - the name of the effect's parent perk (to uniquely identify the effect in the PerkRegistry)
        effectName - the name of the effect
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        EffectActivationException - if no matching active effect exists on the player

      • removeAndDeactivateEffect

        public static void removeAndDeactivateEffect(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                             Effect effect)
        Disables the matched effect for the given player on both the server and client, and removes it from the player's list of active effects. The client will receive updated skill info with the effect removed immediately after it has been disabled.

        Note that this method may only be called from a server context.

        Parameters:
        player - the player from which to remove the effect
        effect - the effect to remove from the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        EffectActivationException - if no matching active effect exists on the player

      • togglePerk

        public static void togglePerk(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
              Perk perk,
              boolean state)
        Toggles all effects of the given perk on both the client and the server. Effects that are currently in the given state will not be affected; that is, active effects will remain activated (and will not be re-activated) if state is true.

        Note that this method explicitly does not check additional perk conditions, such as activatable flags or cooldowns, as it is intended as an internal service method. See activatePerk(EntityPlayer, Perk) and deactivatePerk(EntityPlayer, Perk) for methods that check the appropriate requirements for normal player use.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to toggle the perk on
        perk - the perk to toggle
        state - the new state for all effects of the perk
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        PerkActivationException - if the player doesn't have the given perk

      • addAndActivatePerk

        public static void addAndActivatePerk(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                      Perk perk)
        Adds and activates all effects on the given perk for the specified player, and sends the appropriate new information to the client.

        Note that requirements and costs are not checked or applied by this method: the caller will need to ensure the player is actually eligible for the perk.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to activate the perk on
        perk - the perk to add and activate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        PerkActivationException - if the player already has the given perk

      • removeAndDeactivatePerk

        public static void removeAndDeactivatePerk(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                           Perk perk)
        Removes and deactivates all effects from the given perk for the specified player, and sends the appropriate changes to the client.

        Note that refunds are not checked or applied by this method: the caller will apply any relevant additional changes.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to deactivate and remove the perk from
        perk - the perk to deactivate and remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        PerkActivationException - if the perk is missing from the player

      • activatePerk

        public static void activatePerk(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                Perk perk)
        Activates the given perk (and all of its associated effects) on the player, checking that the player meets all necessary requirements to use it, including any relevant cooldown timers and activation flags.

        Note that this method is intended to be used following a manually-attempted perk activation and makes checks appropriately.

        Parameters:
        player - the player on which to activate the perk
        perk - the perk to activate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when called from a client context
        PerkActivationException - if the player does not have the given perk, if the perk cannot be activated manually, or if the perk's cooldown has not finished.

      • deactivatePerk

        public static void deactivatePerk(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                  Perk perk)
        Deactivated the given perk (and all of its associated effects) for the given player, checking that all necessary requirements are met. In particular, the perk must be flagged as cancellable.

        Note that his method is suitable for use following a manually-attempted perk deactivation and makes checks appropriately.

        Parameters:
        player - the player on which to attempt perk deactivation
        perk - the perk to deactivate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called from a client context
        PerkActivationException - if the player does not have the given perk, or if the perk cannot be cancelled manually
